items.summary: In the `initializeSeedData` function in `backend/main.mo`, add Robert Hood as a new seeded artist with the following 3 real RA events (all with sourceLabel 'RA' and eventUrl 'https://ra.co'): (1) eventTitle 'Dreaming Festival 2026' — venue 'Parque Norte', Medellin, Colombia, Sat 27 Jun 2026, dateTime ISO '2026-06-27T18:00:00Z'; (2) eventTitle 'Terminal V Festival 2026' — venue 'Royal Highland Centre', Edinburgh, UK, Sat 18 Apr 2026, dateTime ISO '2026-04-18T18:00:00Z'; (3) eventTitle 'The Crave Festival 2026' — venue 'Zuiderpark', The Hague, Netherlands, Sat 6 Jun 2026, dateTime ISO '2026-06-06T16:00:00Z'. Robert Hood must have a unique stable artist ID (e.g. 'robert-hood'), name 'Robert Hood', an imageUrl (empty string or placeholder), and genre 'Detroit Techno / Minimal'. All 3 events must be associated with Robert Hood's artist ID. Retain all existing hard-coded events for all other artists (Dave Clarke 9 events, Jeff Mills 16 events, Richie Hawtin, Joey Beltram, Derrick May, Juan Atkins, Kevin Saunderson, Adam Beyer) unchanged. The `postupgrade` system hook must continue to call `initializeSeedData` unconditionally so all artists including Robert Hood are present on every deploy without manual intervention. After the call, `getArtists` must return Robert Hood and `getEventsByArtist` queried with Robert Hood's artist ID must return all 3 events.

Update the IATA/city slug lookup table in `frontend/src/utils/travelLinks.ts` to include the cities introduced by Robert Hood's new event data that are not already present: Medellin (MDE), Edinburgh (EDI), The Hague (nearest major: AMS). Ensure the Skyscanner and Booking.com deep-link URL generators resolve these city names correctly using the lookup table before constructing URLs.

On the frontend, ensure the Artists page grid and the Discover page artist roster strip automatically include Robert Hood once the backend returns him. No hardcoded artist name lists or filtering logic should exclude him. The `useArtists` React Query hook must return all artists from the backend dynamically, and the UI must render Robert Hood's card with his name, event count (3), and a clickable avatar/name that opens the ArtistEventPopup showing his 3 upcoming events.
